caption: Comparison of watermarking performance in terms of watermarked image quality and detection accuracy across various image editing methods. Quality metrics are averaged over 10,000 images, and the TPR@0.1%FPR for each specific editing method is averaged over 5,000 images. The best value in each column is highlighted in bold, and the second best value is underlined. Abbreviations: Cap = Encoding Capacity; Sto = Stochastic Regeneration; Det = Deterministic Regeneration; Pix2Pix = Instruct-Pix2Pix; Ultra = UltraEdit; Magic = MagicBrush; CtrlN = ControlNet-Inpainting; SVD = Stable Video Diffusion.
description: This table presents a comparison of eleven different watermarking methods across various image editing techniques. For each method, it shows the encoding capacity, image quality metrics (PSNR, SSIM, LPIPS, and FID), and the robustness against four types of image editing (image regeneration, global editing, local editing, and image-to-video generation). The image quality metrics are the average over 10,000 images, while the robustness is the average TPR@0.1%FPR over 5,000 images for each editing type.  The best performing methods in each category are highlighted in bold, and the second-best in underlined font.  The table summarizes the overall performance of each watermarking method, enabling a comparison of their strengths and weaknesses across diverse image editing scenarios.

caption: Table 1: Comparison of watermarking performance in terms of watermarked image quality and detection accuracy across various image editing methods. Quality metrics are averaged over 10,000 images, and the TPR@0.1%FPR for each specific editing method is averaged over 5,000 images. The best value in each column is highlighted in bold, and the second best value is underlined. Abbreviations: Cap = Encoding Capacity; Sto = Stochastic Regeneration; Det = Deterministic Regeneration; Pix2Pix = Instruct-Pix2Pix; Ultra = UltraEdit; Magic = MagicBrush; CtrlN = ControlNet-Inpainting; SVD = Stable Video Diffusion.
description: Table 1 presents a comparison of eleven watermarking methods across various image editing techniques, including image regeneration (both stochastic and deterministic), global editing, local editing, and image-to-video generation.  For each method, it shows the encoding capacity (Cap), average image quality metrics (PSNR, SSIM, LPIPS, and FID), and the True Positive Rate at 0.1% False Positive Rate (TPR@0.1%FPR) for each editing type.  The TPR@0.1%FPR values represent the robustness of each watermarking method against the different image editing techniques. Higher values indicate better robustness.  The table highlights the best and second-best performing methods in each column, providing a comprehensive evaluation of the methods' performance across diverse image editing scenarios.

caption: Comparison of watermarking performance in terms of watermarked image quality and detection accuracy across various image editing methods. Quality metrics are averaged over 10,000 images, and the TPR@0.1%FPR for each specific editing method is averaged over 5,000 images. The best value in each column is highlighted in bold, and the second best value is underlined. Abbreviations: Cap = Encoding Capacity; Sto = Stochastic Regeneration; Det = Deterministic Regeneration; Pix2Pix = Instruct-Pix2Pix; Ultra = UltraEdit; Magic = MagicBrush; CtrlN = ControlNet-Inpainting; SVD = Stable Video Diffusion.
description: Table 1 presents a comprehensive comparison of eleven watermarking methods across various metrics, including encoding capacity, image quality (PSNR, SSIM, LPIPS, and FID), and robustness against four types of image editing (Stochastic and Deterministic Regeneration, Global and Local Editing, and Image-to-Video Generation).  For each method, the table shows the average performance across different difficulty levels for each editing type, represented as the True Positive Rate at a 0.1% False Positive Rate (TPR@0.1%FPR).  The best performing method in each category is highlighted in bold, while the second-best is underlined.  The table provides a quantitative overview of the methods' ability to maintain image quality while resisting various image editing techniques.

description: Table 1 presents a quantitative comparison of eleven watermarking methods across various image editing techniques.  For each method, it lists its encoding capacity (Cap), average watermarked image quality metrics (PSNR, SSIM, LPIPS, and FID), and the true positive rate at 0.1% false positive rate (TPR@0.1%FPR) for four types of image editing (Stochastic and Deterministic Regeneration, Global Editing, Local Editing, and Image-to-Video Generation). Each editing type incorporates several specific models or algorithms, and the TPR@0.1%FPR is averaged across these.  The best performance in each category is shown in bold, and the second-best is underlined, providing a comprehensive benchmark of the methods’ robustness and image quality.
